answers.answer: Did the doctor think the situation was hopeless?  Can your wife stay in bed?  I don't know what is usually suggested to build up amniotic fluid, but probably bed rest would not hurt.  If your doctor has a reason for the suggestion of an abortion, I would listen to it, but you could also see another doctor.
Drinking LOTS of fluids can help.
Here's a link that is helpful.Best wishes.http://www.*****************.org/pregnancycomplications/lowamnioticfluidoligohydramnios.htm

Hmmm.  I don't know why that link won't post.If you search on the term Oligohydramnios (low amniotic fluid) you'll find causes can be dehydration of the mother,  diabetes,  hypertension,  inadequate placenta.   Or the problem can be from the baby having inadequate kidney or liver function - at this stage,  the baby's urine is providing most of the amniotic fluid,  so if there is little fluid the cause could be that the baby is unable to process liquids into urine.The link did suggest lots of fluids - either by IV or drinking water.
